title: How to Spy on Your Competitor’s Keywords (Amazon KDP)

tactics.name: reverse_as_lookup
tactics.description: Identify keywords your book is actually ranking for by inputting ISBN10 via Publisher Rocket's reverse AS lookup
steps: Input your book's AS/ISBN10 into Publisher Rocket
Analyze which keywords Amazon is associating with your book
Compare results to your metadata (title, categories, description)
source_quotes: you can see which keywords your book is actually ranking for
Amazon's looking at all of your metadata collectively

heuristics.name: competitive_score_filter
source_quotes: stay away from all of these moderately competitive keywords

claims.statement: Amazon uses collective metadata (title, categories, description) to determine book rankings, not just keyword slots
source_quotes: Amazon's looking at all of your metadata collectively

niche_patterns.description: Targets specific audience segments with unique constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrows competition and identifies underserved niches
source_quotes: If this is the case, not only do you want to have another look at your keywords...
